Description: Polished redware pottery jar: handmade, with a turned (?) rim. There is a dark red slip on the exterior and inside the rim, and it is burnished vertically. The jar is of an unusual shape with two lobes dependent on a single neck.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: G. Brunton, ‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture’ (London, 1937), pl. xxxiv, 16, pl. xxvii, 23; The British Museum, 'British Museum Quarterly' 5 (1930-1931), pl. viii, 6.
Bibliographic references: Bourriau 1981 / Umm el-Ga'ab: Pottery from the Nile Valley Before the Arab Conquest (70)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1996 11 Jul-6 Oct, Japan, Arita, Kyushu Ceramic Museum, Ceramics and Civilisation
